bug.short_desc: lshw-gui does not start from gnome-shell-extension-apps-menu
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Running lshw-gui from the menu I get the following from journalctl -f
lshw.desktop[2223]: Refusing to render service to dead parents.
and I do not get the authentication dialog.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): lshw-gui-B.02.18-3.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.
Actual results:
Expected results:
Additional info:
After little duckduckgoing I found this: http://askubuntu.com/questions/641593/pkexec-command-in-a-desktop-file
After comparing /usr/share/polkit-1/actions/org.ezix.lshw.gui.policy and /usr/bin/lshw-gui, I made a guess (I do not understand this stuff) that the contents of /usr/bin/lshw-gui should be:
#! /bin/bash
/usr/bin/pkexec /usr/sbin/gtk-lshw
rather than:
#! /bin/bash
exec /usr/bin/pkexec /usr/sbin/gtk-lshw
and it now seems to work.
Seems to work both ways for me, however I will add your fix, thanks!
